HorizontalStabilizer¶

class components.liftingsurfaces.horizontalstab.HorizontalStabilizer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This script will generate the horizontal stabilizer using the lifting surface primitive with the required area from the ‘scissorplot.py’ script. Also, the bounding box is made for the section of the HTP within the fuselage, which is used to size the fuselage frames.

Returns:

ParaPy Geometry of the Horizontal Tail Surface
Parameters:
  • planform_area (float) – This is the Required Planfrom Area for the HT from the Scissor Plot in [m^2]
  • aspect_ratio (float) – This is the required Aspect Ratio of the HT Surface corresponding to the scissor plot value.
  • taper (float) – This is the required Taper Ratio of the HT Surface.
  • dihedral (float) – This is the required Dihedral Angle of the HT Surface in degrees.
  • twist (float) – This is the required Twist Angle of the Tip Airfoil w.r.t the Root Airfoil in degrees.
  • offset (float or NoneType) – This is the offset in the flow direction of the tip W.R.T. the root Leading Edge.
  • fuse_width_factor (float) – This is the assumed factor of the semispan which the fuselage extends over the HT semispan
  • color (tuple) – Changes the color of the wing skin to the one defined in MyColors
  • airfoil_type (str) – This is the name of the folder within the ‘airfoils’ folder. There are three options ‘cambered’, ‘reflexed’ and ‘symmetric’.
  • airfoil_choice (str) – This is the filename of the requested airfoil.
  • ply_number (int) – Changes the number of ply’s of carbon fiber pre-preg.
airfoil_choice¶

Below is the tail airfoil DAT file. The input must correspond to an existing filename.

airfoil_type¶

Below is the tail airfoil type. The input must correspond to an existing folder.

aspect_ratio¶

Below is the required HT aspect ratio.

center_of_gravity[source]¶

This shows the COG which was found from one wing and translated to origin. This is because because the fused shape does not exhibit a C.G.

Returns:ParaPy Point of HT CG
Return type:Point
color¶

Changes the color of the wing skin to the one defined in MyColors

component_type[source]¶

This attribute names the component ‘ht’ for horizontal stabilizer.

Returns:Name of HT
Return type:str
dihedral = 0.0¶

Below is the tail dihedral angle.

external_shape[source]¶

This part is the external shape of the HT.

Returns:Fused Shape of left and right HT surfaces
Return type:Fused
fuse_width_factor¶

Below is the assumed factor relating the part of the HT covered by fuse to semispan

get_htfuse_bounds[source]¶

This attribute is obtaining (the dimensions of) a bounded box at a fuselage width factor of the semispan which will be used to size the fuselage frames. These frames drive the shape of the fuselage.

Returns:ParaPy Bounding Box
Return type:bbox
ht_mirror[source]¶

This is a mirrored shape of the right HT.

Returns:HT left wing half
Return type:MirroredShape
htright_cut_plane[source]¶

This makes a plane at the right HT span location where the fuselage is to end.

Returns:ParaPy Plane to cut HT
Return type:Plane
htwing_cut_loc[source]¶

This calculates the spanwise distance of the cut, inside of which, the HT is inside the fuselage. This location is where the HT bbox to size the fuselage frame(s) ends in the spanwise direction. The height of this bbox is the maximum thickness of the wing at this cut location.

Returns:Spanwise distance from HT root chord to cut location
Return type:float
internal_shape[source]¶

This part creates the bounding box for the part of the HT within the fuselage.

Returns:HT fuselage Sizing bbox
Return type:Box
offset¶

Below is the chosen trailing edge offset.

planform_area¶

Below is the required tail surface area from the scissor plot.

ply_number¶

Changes the number of ply’s of carbon fiber http://www.ijera.com/papers/Vol4_issue5/Version%202/J45025355.pdf

taper = 1.0¶

Below is the required HT taper ratio.

twist¶

Below is the tail wing twist angle.
